isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 3700 AND 3800 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT - PULL TYPE CLUTCHES

svcprocinfo.para: Two types of adjustments must be made: (1) clutch internal release bearing adjustment and (2) external (linkage) adjustment.

important.para: Do not change the external (linkage) adjustment without checking the internal adjustment first. Changing the external adjustment to restore pedal free travel will not compensate for an improperly adjusted clutch.

svcprocinfo.para: The following procedures cover only the external linkage adjustments.

note.para: You must refer to the specific clutch section in GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for internal adjustment procedure.

svcprocinfo.para: After adjusting the clutch, adjust the clutch linkage to obtain the specified release shaft yoke (fork) to release bearing housing clearance ( Figure 3) as outlined below. This adjustment will provide the specified pedal free travel.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Typical Adjusting Yoke at Front of Horizontal Control Rod

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles With the Adjusting Yoke at the Front End of the the Lower (Horizontal) Control Rod:

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) clutch control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter pin and clevis pin and disconnect the lower control rod from the relay shaft inner lever.
Insert a .28" (7 mm) spacer gauge between the clutch pedal shank and the pedal return stop. (Spacer gauge can be made locally).

important.para: Use a .34" (8.8 mm) spacer gauge on APPLY having the pedal return spring connected to the upper (vertical) clutch control rod.

step1.para: Pull the lower control rod forward until the release shaft yoke (fork) contacts the release bearing housing.
Holding the rod in the forward position (per Step 4), adjust the control rod yoke until the clevis pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and relay shaft lever.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.

Operate the clutch pedal and check clutch release and clutch brake application. The clutch should fully release and the clutch brake (where equipped) should apply before the clutch pedal contacts the floor panel.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles With the Adjusting Yoke at the Rear End of the Lower (Horizontal) Control Rod:

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) clutch control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter pin and clevis pin and disconnect the lower control rod from release shaft lever.
Insert a .28" (7 mm) spacer gauge between the clutch pedal shank and pedal return stop. (Spacer gauge can be made locally.)

important.para: Use .34" (8.8 mm) spacer gauge on APPLY having the pedal return spring connected to the upper (vertical) clutch control rod.

step1.para: Pull the release shaft lever forward until the release shaft yoke (fork) contacts the release bearing housing.
Holding the lever rod in forward position (per Step 4), adjust the control rod yoke until clevis pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and release shaft lever.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.

Operate the clutch pedal and check clutch release and clutch brake application. The clutch should fully release and the clutch brake (where equipped) should apply before the clutch pedal contacts the floor panel.
